Package javelin.model.world.location

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstructionSite, DeepDungeon, Dungeon, Fortification, Gate, Hub, Portal, ResourceSite, Shop, Slums, Town
    public abstract class Location
extends Actor
    A Actor that is actually a place that represent a location to be entered or explored. Im may be tempted to add a uniform #level here for subclass convenience, but having the same on each subclass that needs it bring more benefits, from code efficiency to ease of searching calls and assignments. The very small convenience added is not worth the trade-off.
    See Also:
    World.getactors(), Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • allowentry

        public boolean allowentry
        If false will make sure no Squad occupies the same World space as this.

      • garrison

        public Combatants garrison
        Represent a list of units positioned inside a world feature.

      • sacrificeable

        public boolean sacrificeable
        If true, the computer will destroy this instead of positioning a garrison here.
        See Also:
        destroy(javelin.model.world.Incursion)

      • discard

        public boolean discard
        If this feature should be Actor.remove()d after interact().

      • description

        public java.lang.String description
        Used for toString().

      • gossip

        public boolean gossip
        Allows use of Diplomacy.

      • vision

        protected int vision
        Used to calculate fog of war. Usually rangess from 1 (most Fortifications, to 3 (Outposts), with Towns being the benchmark for 2. UniqueLocations usually have none since they're minding their own business.

      • link

        public boolean link
        Link with a road if nearby.

      • showgarrison

        protected boolean showgarrison
        If false, will not show individual units.
        See Also:
        WorldMouse, Squad#spot(List)

      • interact

        public static boolean interact​(Location l)
        Called when this place is reached with the active Squad.
        Returns:
        true if the Squad is able to interact with this place, false if a garrison defends it.
        Throws:
        StartBattle

      • destroy

        public java.lang.Boolean destroy​(Incursion attacker)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an incursion reaches this actor's location.
        Specified by:
        destroy in class Actor
        Returns:
        true if this place gets destroyed, false if the Incursion is destroyed or null if neither.
        See Also:
        Incursion#ignore(Incursion), Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • defend

        protected boolean defend()
        Returns:
        false if this is unguarded, true if it is guarded but the player aborted combat.
        Throws:
        StartBattle - If the player chooses to attack a defended location.

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(java.lang.Integer attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level... (may pass null to locations which should be "absolute" EL)
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)
